intro: Gonolobus haitiensis, commonly known as Haitian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Haiti. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces violet to blue flowers that open in the morning and close in the afternoon. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and twining. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in disturbed soils or along forest edges.
